I've been working on a Mural board for Backdrop LIVE. Please, check it out. Provide feedback and/or ideas.

Go ahead and add some content. How can we use this to help engage with participants during the event.
http://bit.ly/3bgR3ye

Backdrop LIVE
Anyone with link should be able to edit. Let me know if it's not working for you.
@klonos have you had a chance to checkout the Mural?

How can we use this to help engage with participants during the event.

This sounds like a case of "implement a solution, then work out what problem it solves" :laughing:

@StPaulTim that seems like something project managers at my work would use - I've never used such a tool before, so not sure how to make use of it. Happy to screenshare with someone that does, so that I can learn.

This sounds like a case of "implement a solution, then work out what problem it solves"

@BWPanda - I appreciate your making this point. I've been known to make it myself. Recently, I've raised these questions to a very different issue.

1) What is the problem we are trying to solve?
2) Is this the best solution?

In this case, the problem is very real. In planning any event, especially a virtual event, I think that the problem of engaging the audience and keeping them interested is one of the most important problems to think about. I believe that the success of almost any event is largely influenced by how engaged the audience was and how well we did at keeping their attention. People are not likely to learn a lot and/or change their behaviors based upon participation in an event, if they were not engaged and focused.

As the advocate for and author of the Mural Board, there has never been any doubt or lack of clarity in my mind, about what problem I am trying to solve.Whether or not this is the right tool or the best tool to solve the problem could be debated. I happen to think that a Mural Board has the potential to increase engagement among some users (hopefully a lot of users) and am looking for creative ways to use this tool to solve this problem, hence my question which might have been better phrased, "How can we best use this tool to solve the problem of stimulating maximum engagement during Backdrop LIVE?" At the same time, I know that no one tool, technique, or format is going to work for all users.

Another legitimate question would be - "Is this the right tool and/or
what other ideas or tools might work better or in coordination with a Mural board?"

I'd love feedback on either.

(Sorry for long response, but this is a topic I think about a lot and enjoy discussing, so I appreciated your question.)

that seems like something project managers at my work would use - I've never used such a tool before, so not sure how to make use of it. Happy to screenshare with someone that does, so that I can learn.

Interesting and important feedback. I tried to set up the Mural Board with built in instructions and the best UI that I could with the tools provided. But, I totally get that it might not be clear. I can think about ways of making it's purpose and how to use it clearer OR accept that it might not be the right tool for this task.

At this stage, I'm inclined to continue the experiment, recognizing that it is an experiment and without putting too much emphasis on it.

Personally, I think that the tool has potential for the following:

1) An event bulletin board
2) Collective note taking
3) A kind of "Water Cooler" where participants can share information about themselves, ask questions, and feel connected to the community - depending upon participation.
4) A BOF board
5) Etc.
Anyone able to explain what a mural board is, for those of us who have never heard of it before?

Anyone able to explain what a mural board is, for those of us who have never heard of it before?

@BWPanda I'm working on it! :-)

I just published this blog post. Feedback welcome.
https://backdropcms.org/news/an-engaging-and-interactive-backdrop-live

I'm thinking about another shorter one with screenshots on how to use the board.

@BWPanda - Is this helpful. I tried to keep it short and focus on only the most important points.
https://backdropcms.org/news/how-to-use-mural-at-backdrop-live
Sure, especially the last part.

Organizing and facilitating online events is one of my other favorite things to do. Hence, I'm spending too much time playing with this tool that interest me and hoping that it will be useful to the BackdropCMS community.
@StPaulTim ++
stpaultim :grinning: :heart: (Karma: 36)
...having read the blog post, I now see how this can be useful. Especially the "without needing permission or assistance from website administrators" bit :+1:

...how do we prevent spam on the board though @StPaulTim? ...or anyone potentially coming and destroying things? (my mind cannot help but think about security issues, sorry) ...does this mural support revisions?
Blog post said it had revisions
https://backdropcms.org/news/how-to-use-mural-at-backdrop-live

...and now feedback re the actual UX: I now see the outline with the numbered steps to the right of the board :+1: (did not notice it the first time I gave it a quick look). Clicking on "Getting Started" takes me to the numbered list of how to use the mural :+1: ...but the "zoom in ...zoom out" could use some tips on how to do that ...being used from other UIs, I tried my mouse wheel, but that didn't work. I then noticed that for my screen size, the zoom controls are hidden by the "Announcements" title:
image.png

...perhaps we can move/resize that title, so that it doesn't overlap with the controls to the bottom right of the mural, but it may not work for all screen sizes. Using a different font color may help (?)
...perhaps merge point 1 and 5 (both are about zooming)
I think I made it better ...feel free to revert my changes if you think it's worse :sweat_smile:

I think I made it better ...feel free to revert my changes if you think it's worse

Thanks. Anyone should feel free to edit anything that is not locked. If it's locked, you won't be able to edit it. I think your edits helped. I tweaked them slightly to emphasize the zoom settings. Choosing between trackpad and mouse is important (in the settings).

@klonos klonos:

...how do we prevent spam on the board though @StPaulTim? ...or anyone potentially coming and destroying things? (my mind cannot help but think about security issues, sorry) ...does this mural support revisions?

1) Making it easy for people to edit without having to be invited or make accounts, does make it vulnerable to SPAM or vandalism. However, I believe that these risks are very small - especially if we don't do anything like directly share the link in social media.

2) I may have over stated the revisions (I believed it to be true at the time). In fact, it's easy to recover deleted items. But, it's not so easy to revert edited items (not as easy as I thought). My new plan is to manually make a copy of the board at least once a day until Backdrop LIVE is over - and to not worry about it too much. It's there to be used and edited.

It's weird, because it does keep little snapshots of each change made. But, some of the snapshots are illegible to read and you can't just revert (unless it's something someone deleted). So, there is this little visual history, but it's not always helpful.

Should we just make this the official schedule:
